org.opends.server.backends.jeb

Class IndexQueryFactoryImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.backends.jeb.IndexQueryFactoryImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexQueryFactory<IndexQuery>

    public final class IndexQueryFactoryImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IndexQueryFactory<IndexQuery>
    This class is an implementation of IndexQueryFactory which creates IndexQuery objects as part of the query of the JEB index.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IndexQueryFactoryImpl(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Index> indexMap)
      Creates a new IndexQueryFactoryImpl object.

      Returns a query which returns the intersection of a collection of sub-queries.
      IndexQuery createMatchAllQuery()
      Returns a query requesting all index records.
      IndexQuery createRangeMatchQuery(java.lang.String indexID, ByteSequence lowerBound, ByteSequence upperBound, boolean includeLowerBound, boolean includeUpperBound)
      Returns a query requesting all index records in the specified range.
      IndexQuery createUnionQuery(java.util.Collection<IndexQuery> subqueries)
      Returns a query which combines the results of a collection of sub-queries.

    • Method Detail

      • createExactMatchQuery

        public IndexQuery createExactMatchQuery(java.lang.String indexID,
                               ByteSequence value)
        Returns a query requesting an index record matching the provided key.
        Specified by:
        createExactMatchQuery in interface IndexQueryFactory<IndexQuery>
        Parameters:
        indexID - An identifier of the index type.
        value - A byte sequence containing the key.
        Returns:
        A query requesting the index record matching the key.

      • createRangeMatchQuery

        public IndexQuery createRangeMatchQuery(java.lang.String indexID,
                               ByteSequence lowerBound,
                               ByteSequence upperBound,
                               boolean includeLowerBound,
                               boolean includeUpperBound)
        Returns a query requesting all index records in the specified range.
        Specified by:
        createRangeMatchQuery in interface IndexQueryFactory<IndexQuery>
        Parameters:
        indexID - An identifier of the index type.
        lowerBound - The lower bound of the range. A 0 length byte array indicates no lower bound and the range will start from the smallest key.
        upperBound - The upper bound of the range. A 0 length byte array indicates no upper bound and the range will end at the largest key.
        includeLowerBound - true if a key exactly matching the lower bound is included in the range, false if only keys strictly greater than the lower bound are included.This value is ignored if the lower bound is not specified.
        includeUpperBound - true if a key exactly matching the upper bound is included in the range, false if only keys strictly less than the upper bound are included. This value is ignored if the upper bound is not specified.
        Returns:
        A query requesting all index records in the specified range.

      • createIntersectionQuery

        public IndexQuery createIntersectionQuery(java.util.Collection<IndexQuery> subqueries)
        Returns a query which returns the intersection of a collection of sub-queries.
        Specified by:
        createIntersectionQuery in interface IndexQueryFactory<IndexQuery>
        Parameters:
        subqueries - A collection of sub-queries.
        Returns:
        A query which returns the intersection of a collection of sub-queries.

      • createUnionQuery

        public IndexQuery createUnionQuery(java.util.Collection<IndexQuery> subqueries)
        Returns a query which combines the results of a collection of sub-queries.
        Specified by:
        createUnionQuery in interface IndexQueryFactory<IndexQuery>
        Parameters:
        subqueries - A collection of sub-queries.
        Returns:
        A query which combines the results of a collection of sub-queries.

      • createMatchAllQuery

        public IndexQuery createMatchAllQuery()
        Returns a query requesting all index records. A backend implementation may choose to return all or no records as part of the optimization.

        It returns an empty EntryIDSet object when either all or no record sets are requested.

        Specified by:
        createMatchAllQuery in interface IndexQueryFactory<IndexQuery>
        Returns:
        A query requesting all index records.
